MODULE.name: System
MODULE.HELP_OVERVIEW: The System API is used to control and modify core aspects of the device such as the screen, OS and device capabilities.
MODULE.MORE_HELP:
## Enabling the API This API is part of the `coreapi` extension that is included automatically. :::ruby extensions: ["coreapi"]
## JavaScript Usage Be sure to review the [JavaScript API Usage](/guide/api_js) guide for important information about using this API in JavaScript.
## Ruby Usage Be sure to review the [Ruby API Usage](/guide/api_ruby) guide for important information about using this API in Ruby.

PROPERTIES.DESC: The System API supports the following properties.

PROPERTY.name: main_window_closed
PROPERTY.DESC: It is internal property for using in debugger (signal for main window close).

PROPERTY.name: platform
PROPERTY.DESC: Platform where application is running.

PROPERTY.name: hasCamera
PROPERTY.DESC: Returns true if there is a camera available on the device.

PROPERTY.name: screenWidth
PROPERTY.DESC: Screen width in logical pixels (used for set coordinates).

PROPERTY.name: screenHeight
PROPERTY.DESC: Screen height in logical pixels (used for set coordinates).

PROPERTY.name: realScreenWidth
PROPERTY.DESC: Screen width in real pixels.

PROPERTY.name: realScreenHeight
PROPERTY.DESC: Screen height in real pixels.

PROPERTY.name: screenOrientation
PROPERTY.DESC: Current screen orientation.

VALUE.DESC: The return value if the screen is in portrait mode.
The return value if the screen is in landscape mode.

PROPERTY.name: ppiX
PROPERTY.DESC: Horizontal PPI (Pixels Per Inch).

PROPERTY.name: ppiY
PROPERTY.DESC: Vertical PPI (Pixels Per Inch).

PROPERTY.name: deviceOwnerEmail
PROPERTY.DESC: Primary email of phone owner. To access this property 'pim' capability must be enabled in your build.yml.

PROPERTY.name: deviceOwnerName
PROPERTY.DESC: Name(account name) of phone owner. To access this property 'pim' capability must be enabled in your build.yml.

PROPERTY.name: devicePushId
PROPERTY.DESC: Push notifications device ID which may be used to receive push messages.To get this ID , Push service should be configured on the device. Please refer to Push documentation.

PROPERTY.name: phoneId
PROPERTY.DESC: Hardware based ID. It depends on capabilities configured for an application and has to remain same even across application uninstall/install.(except iOS ! - on iOS unisntall/reinstall will update this property - used UIDebice.identifierForVendor)

PROPERTY.name: deviceName
PROPERTY.DESC: Name of device application running on. Examples: '9000' (BB), 'iPhone', 'dream' (Android). In Consumer Android device, name of the Industrial Design along with manufacturer name shall be shown.

PROPERTY.name: osVersion
PROPERTY.DESC: Version OS of device. Examples: '4.1' (Android).

PROPERTY.name: locale
PROPERTY.DESC: Current device locale Like 'en', 'ru' etc.

PROPERTY.name: country
PROPERTY.DESC: Current device country code.

PROPERTY.name: isEmulator
PROPERTY.DESC: Returns true if the application is running on a platform emulator.

PROPERTY.name: isRhoSimulator
PROPERTY.DESC: Returns true if the application is running on RhoSimulator.

PROPERTY.name: hasCalendar
PROPERTY.DESC: Returns true if calendar support is available.

PROPERTY.name: isSymbolDevice
PROPERTY.DESC: Returns true if the device supports Symbol device capabilities. APIs will indicate if the property or method is available on Symbol devices only. You can use this property to help your application decide when to take advantage of advanced Symbol capabilities.

PROPERTY.name: oemInfo
PROPERTY.DESC: The OEM Information string for the terminal.

PROPERTY.name: uuid
PROPERTY.DESC: The Unique Unit IDentifier for the terminal.

PROPERTY.name: applicationIconBadge
PROPERTY.DESC: Set the application icon to have this badge number. Set to 0 (zero) to remove badge.

PROPERTY.name: httpProxyURI
PROPERTY.DESC: Set HTTP proxy parameters for using the Network module. Example: 'user:password@url:port'. Supports basic authentication only. Do not include 'http://'. Setting this property overrides http_proxy_uri, http_proxy_host, http_proxy_port, http_proxy_user and http_proxy_password. Proxy settings for Windows Mobile/CE with Zebra WebKit should be configured in the config.xml file.

PROPERTY.name: lockWindowSize
PROPERTY.DESC: Lock / unlock the window size change by the user. When running on RhoSimulator, this method is supported only for Windows OS.

PROPERTY.name: keyboardState
PROPERTY.DESC: For Windows Mobile and Windows CE the keyboard can be manually shown or hidden as required. All other platforms only support 'automatic'. The default state for Windows Mobile and Windows CE is manual, for all other platforms it is automatic.

VALUE.DESC: Shows the on screen keyboard, after setting the keyboard to shown or hidden it will no longer appear / disappear automatically until you set this property to automatic.

Hides the on screen keyboard, after setting the keyboard to shown or hidden it will no longer appear / disappear automatically until you set this property to automatic. This is most useful if your device has a hardware keyboard or you are scanning / capturing data to an input field.
Automatically shows or hides the keyboard as needed by the application.

PROPERTY.name: localServerPort
PROPERTY.DESC: Port of the local (embedded) HTTP server. This parameter is mainly for debug purposes. If not specified, the platform will detect a free port on the device and use that one.

PROPERTY.name: NodejsServerPort
PROPERTY.DESC: Port of the local (embedded) Node.js HTTP server if it started (only for Node.js type applications).

PROPERTY.name: freeServerPort
PROPERTY.DESC: Get free local server port, available for binding.

PROPERTY.name: screenAutoRotate
PROPERTY.DESC: Screen auto rotate.

PROPERTY.name: hasTouchscreen
PROPERTY.DESC: Returns true if the device has touch screen capabilities. For Win32 desktop builds this API will return whether mouse support is available.

PROPERTY.name: webviewFramework
PROPERTY.DESC: Browser framework identity string.

PROPERTY.name: screenSleeping
PROPERTY.DESC: If true, then screen will go to sleep by system inactivity timeout. If false then screen never go to sleep while application is in foreground.

PROPERTY.name: hasNetwork
PROPERTY.DESC: Use Network.hasNetwork to tell if the device is connected to the network.

PROPERTY.name: hasWifiNetwork
PROPERTY.DESC: Use Network.hasWifiNetwork to tell if the device is connected to the wifi network.

PROPERTY.name: hasCellNetwork
PROPERTY.DESC: Use Network.hasCellNetwork to tell if device is connected to the cell network.

PROPERTY.name: hasSqlite
PROPERTY.DESC: Returns true if the device has sqlite capabilities (previously only BlackBerry did not support this).

METHOD.name: applicationInstall
METHOD.DESC: Install an application.

PARAM.name: applicationUrl
PARAM.DESC: The url of an application to install on the device.

METHOD.name: isApplicationInstalled
METHOD.DESC: Checks if the specified applicationName is installed on the device.

PARAM.name: applicationName
PARAM.DESC: The name of the application.

METHOD.name: applicationUninstall
METHOD.DESC: Uninstall the application. Not Supported on Windows CE devices.

PARAM.name: applicationName
PARAM.DESC: The name of the application.

METHOD.name: getStartParams
METHOD.DESC: Return the command line parameters. At Android start parameters are returned as URL query string starting with '?', name-value delimiter '=' and name value pairs delimiter '&'.

METHOD.name: openUrl
METHOD.DESC: Open the application associated with the URL. Behavior may be different on different platforms and depend on installed software. For example, open URL with http:// prefix will execute the Web Browser installed on system and open URL in executed browser. Note: For opening pdf files on android devices it is necessary to add option "no_compression: [ pdf ]" to android section in build.yml. In android, "sms:","mailto:","tel:","http:","https:","file:" are supported. For file url the proper permission and path has to be given. For external storage space fully qualified path has to be given.(Example:-file:///storage/sdcard/sample.jpg). Hence only external storage space and userFolder are supported for file uri in android.

PARAM.name: url
PARAM.DESC: URL as string.

METHOD.name: setRegistrySetting
METHOD.DESC: Set a value in the device registry. Only applicable on Windows Mobile / Embedded Handheld and CE devices. When running on RhoSimulator, this method is supported only for Windows OS.

PARAM.name: propertyMap
PARAM.DESC: Map of properties associated with the registry key being set.

PARAM.name: hive
PARAM.DESC: The hive name.

VALUE.DESC: Set the property in the HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT hive.
Set the property in the HKEY_CURRENT_USER hive.
Set the property in the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE hive.
Set the property in the HKEY_USERS hive.

PARAM.name: type
PARAM.DESC: The type.

VALUE.DESC: The type of the value being set is a string.
The type of the value being set is a binary number.
The type of the value being set is a natural number (DWORD)
The type of the value being set is a multi line string. Separate your lines with \n (\\n in JavaScript)

PARAM.name: key
PARAM.DESC: Full path of the key, including '\' separators as required. Remember to use '\\' in JavaScript to specify backslash.

PARAM.name: setting
PARAM.DESC: The name of the registry setting to be set.

PARAM.name: value
PARAM.DESC: The registry value to be set.

PARAM.name: persistent
PARAM.DESC: Whether or not to create a corresponding merge file, setting to true will cause your value to persist across a device clean boot. A .reg file is written to the \Application folder on the device to persist the setting.

RETURN.DESC: Whether or not the registry key was successfully set.

METHOD.name: getRegistrySetting
METHOD.DESC: Retrieve a value from the device registry. Only applicable on Windows Mobile / Embedded Handheld and CE devices. When running on RhoSimulator, this method is supported only for Windows OS.

PARAM.name: propertyMap
PARAM.DESC: Map of properties associated with the registry key being set.

PARAM.name: hive
PARAM.DESC: The hive name, see setRegistrySetting.

PARAM.name: key
PARAM.DESC: Full path of the key, including '\' separators as required. Remember to use '\\' in JavaScript to specify backslash.

PARAM.name: setting
PARAM.DESC: The name of the setting to be retrieved.

METHOD.name: deleteRegistrySetting
METHOD.DESC: Deletes the specified value from the device registry. Only applicable on Windows Mobile / Embedded Handheld and CE devices. When running on RhoSimulator, this method is supported only for Windows OS.

PARAM.name: propertyMap
PARAM.DESC: Map of properties associated with the registry key being set.

PARAM.name: hive
PARAM.DESC: The hive name, setRegistrySetting.

PARAM.name: key
PARAM.DESC: Full path of the key, including '\' separators as required. Remember to use '\\' in JavaScript to specify backslash.

PARAM.name: setting
PARAM.DESC: The name of the setting to be deleted.

PARAM.name: persistent
PARAM.DESC: If the registry value was set to be persistent, ie a corresponding .reg file was created in the \Application folder then setting true here will delete that .reg file.

RETURN.DESC: Whether or not the registry key was successfully deleted.

SECTION.DESC: You can find out whether the device has access to several system-dependent features such as calendar, camera, touchscreen, etc.
Retrieve the version of the underlying Operating System.
You can ask the system to install or uninstall a different application. This feature is useful for installing sub-applications, custom upgrades, etc.

CODE.RUBY:
#install an application from given url Rho::System.applicationInstall("/bin/target/android/rhodes-app-debug.apk")
# uninstall the application Rho::System.applicationUninstall("rhodes-app")

EXAMPLE.title: Get the local server port for debug purposes

SECTION.DESC: If necessary, you can read the embedded HTTP server's port, for debugging purposes.

CODE.RUBY: # Get port of the local (embedded) HTTP served local_port = Rho::System.localServerPort() Alert.show_popup(local_port)

SECTION.DESC: If you ever need to build or extract zip archives, RhoMobile includes easy-to-use APIs for this task.

CODE.RUBY:
# unzip a file Rho::System.unzipFile("/app/public/sample.zip")
# zip a file Rho::System.zipFile("/app/public", "/app/public/sample.txt")

SECTION.DESC: On devices running Windows Mobile, Windows CE, Windows Embedded Handheld and Windows Embedded CE it is possible to interact with the registry, this example shows how to do that.

CODE.RUBY:
#/app/Model
# Retrieve a value from the Registry def get_registry_sync theRegSetting = Rho::System.getRegistrySetting({hive:'HKLM', key:'software', Setting:'RhoElementsTest'}) puts "Registry Setting retrieved: #{theRegSetting}" end
# Set a value in the registry which will persist across a clean boot of the device def set_registry_sync theRegSetting = Rho::System.setRegistrySetting({hive:'HKLM', type:'String', key:'Software', setting:'RhoElementsTest', value:'MVC ftw', persistent:true}) puts "Registry Setting Success?: #{theRegSetting}" end
# Delete a value from the registry def delete_registry_sync theRegSetting = Rho::System.deleteRegistrySetting({hive:'HKLM', key:'Software', setting:'RhoElementsTest', persistent:true}) puts "Registry Deleting Success?: #{theRegSetting}" end
